channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: OGE Dissertation and Thesis Preparation Workshop
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 18, 2026 2:30 PM - 4:00 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles—plus a review of the most commonly found mistakes and ways to avoid them. This workshop is for any student who will be writing a MS thesis or PhD dissertation. Bring your questions! To register for this WebEx event: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd7r-EC56OG3pITP5PeyCkAHSy15aUolvEtxU5WIw6x2y7E_w/viewform?usp…
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer Dining Survey Time
item.description: Help shape the future of Rensselaer Dining by taking our annual survey and win a private chef experience for you and 5 friends! All students that take the survey are eligible for this giveaway. Last day to take the survey is Friday, February 13th 2026. For more information and how to take the survey click the link above.
item.author: Students

item.title: Apartment Search 101 Workshops
item.description: The Off-Campus Services Office will be holding workshops to learn about the process, resources available, and important considerations in selecting your housing. 2/19 2:30-4:30 p.m. RU3602 2/20 2:30-3:30 p.m. RU3202 2/25 2:30-4:30 p.m. 1525 15th St Questions, please email offcampus@rpi.edu
item.author: Students

item.title: President’s Day Weekend Hours for Dining Halls and Retail
item.description: Dining and Retail locations will operate on adjusted hours from Saturday, February 14th through Monday, February 16th. Click the link above for hours of operations. Thank you and enjoy your President’s Day Weekend!
item.author: Students

item.title: Success Center Exam Prep.: Physics II & Strengths of Materials
item.description: Dates: February 18 Drop-in Sessions in the Success Center, Folsom Library 1st Floor: Physics II - 7-9pm Strength of Materials - 7-9pm
item.author: Students

item.title: McKinney Writing Contest Open Through March 9
item.description: The 2026 McKinney Writing Contest is open from November 1, 2025 through March 9, 2026. Submit in any or all of the following categories: Fiction, Creative Nonfiction, or Drama; Poetry; Academic Essay; Language & Image; or our NEW category: Writing for Games. Undergraduate and graduate divisions. First prize $300; 2nd prize $175; and 3rd prize $75. Submit: https://hass.rpi.edu/mckinney. Current students only. Questions? McKinney@rpi.edu
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Semiconductor CoLab Catalyst Seminar Series – February 2026
item.description: Date: Tuesday, February 17, 2026 3:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The RPI Semiconductor CoLab Catalyst Seminar Series brings together faculty, researchers, and industry partners to share ideas, highlight collaborations, and advance semiconductor and microelectronics innovation. The seminar on February 17th, at the Albany NanoTech Complex, features Boon Ooi (RPI) and Walid Redjem (IBM) in a two 45-min talks with a networking break. Registration is required. Follow the link for more information.
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Seminar: Dr. Hui Fang
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 18, 2026 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Materials & Device Engineering to Advance Neuroscience and Medicine: From Atoms to Bits Dr. Hui Fang Dartmouth
item.author: Community

item.title: Upcoming closures in Shuttle services
item.description: Friendly reminder that shuttles do not operate on holidays or during University closures. In observance of Presidents Day (February 16) and Spring Break (February 28–March 7), shuttles will not be running. Please plan accordingly.
item.author: Community

item.title: Campus Card Office Closure – Presidents Day
item.description: Please note that the Campus Card Office will be closed in observance of Presidents Day on Monday, February 16, 2026. The office will resume normal business hours on Tuesday, February 17, 2026.
item.author: Community

item.title: Information Security - Help us name our new AI Phishing Coach!
item.description: Our Information Security team is excited to announce that we will be deploying our new AI Phishing Coach, and are asking for our RPI Community’s assistance with sending us creative and fun names through our naming contest. Click above link to submit proposed names. Best name submission will win RPI merchandise! Submissions will close February 23rd.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rπ Giving Day πK (5K) on March 14
item.description: Date: Tuesday, February 17, 2026 - Sun , March 8, 2026 (all day) - Registration is now open for the Rπ Giving Day πK (5K) on March 14 at 11 a.m.! Join the campus community for a spirited run/walk with Pep Band, Puckman, trivia, giveaways, brunch at the Commons (with registration), and pi-themed medals. Run on campus or participate virtually — every mile supports Rπ Giving Day. Sign up today and share your experience with #RPi314.
item.author: Community

item.title: Webinar Friday February 20: Webex Application Training
item.description: Join us on Friday, February 20, from 11am-12pm for a hands-on Webex Training Session, part of the MMS Collaboration Software Training series. This session focuses on the Webex application and its integration with Outlook and Blackboard, so you can efficiently schedule, launch, and manage meetings directly from the tools you use every day. Register now: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Mercer Lecture: “Power Grid Operations: Past, Present, and Future”
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 18, 2026 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join us for an ECSE Mercer Lecture: “Power Grid Operations: Past, Present, and Future” with Kwok W. Cheung, Founder and CEO of KC-Exousia Consulting. Abstract and speaker bio can be found at the event URL.
item.author: Community

item.title: SoE Spring 2026 Midterm Course Surveys: Adding Additional Questions to a Course Section (Instructor Training)
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 18, 2026 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Learn how to add additional questions to your School of Engineering Student Survey Midterm. The institute has standard defined questions for the SoE midterm, but if you wanted to add a few questions on top of what is already defined this training is for you. Please click the link in the See section to register.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: MBA for Professional Review
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, February 18, 2026 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with a real-world MBA experience. Prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations. Engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential. Join RPI at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for Professionals program. Please register to receive login details to join this virtual event.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
